thread.title: Nato launches biggest military exercise in years
thread.title_full: Nato launches biggest military exercise in years | News24

author: news24.com
title: Nato launches biggest military exercise in years
text:
Trapani - Nato is launching its biggest military exercise in 13 years, mobilising 36 000 soldiers, sailors and airforce personnel from more than 30 countries to test the alliance's ability to respond to new security threats.
Nato deputy secretary-general Alexander Vershbow told the opening ceremony on Monday that the Trident Juncture exercise will demonstrate that Nato "can deal with everything from conventional military engagements to more subtle hybrid warfare techniques and propaganda."
Vershbow said the geopolitical situation is considerably more unstable than the last time such large-scale exercises were held during the Cold War, citing Russia's annexation of Crimea, support of eastern Ukrainian separatists and attacks against moderate rebels in Syria, as well as the spread of terror groups into Libya and Syria.
"In this new world, Nato's allies and partners must be able to move quickly and act decisively," he said.
